```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
scene.width = 700
scene.height = 400

# Cyber Input Variable Mapping
Height_I = 5

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)
v0 = 10   # initial velocity

# Objects
ground = box(pos=vector(0, -0.5, 0), size=vector(20, 1, 1), color=color.green)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, Height_I, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.red, make_trail=True)

# Initial conditions
ball.velocity = vector(v0, 0, 0)

# Animation loop
dt = 0.01
t = 0

while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos.x += ball.velocity.x * dt
    ball.velocity.y -= g * dt
    ball.pos.y += ball.velocity.y * dt
    
    if ball.pos.y < ground.pos.y + ball.radius:
        ball.velocity.y *= -0.9  # Bounce with some loss of energy
        
    t += dt
    
    # Cyber Input Variable Mapping Update Check
    if Height_I != ball.pos.y:  
        ball.pos = vector(0, Height_I, 0)
        ball.velocity = vector(v0, 0, 0)
        t = 0
``` 

This code sets up the VPython environment with the specified canvas size and creates an animation demonstrating horizontal projectile motion. The ball is launched from an initial height with an initial velocity and accelerates under gravity, bouncing off the ground elastically. The animation will rerun when the initial height is updated.
